alert.note: Alert for City of Danville; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 12:08AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Danville and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1205 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in Countywide. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Minor flooding is possible countywide. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected overnight. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danville... Altavista... Hurt... Chatham... Gretna... Blairs... Callands... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
